Greenwich ''Ballet Russes,'' directed by Daniel Geller and Dayna Goldfine. Friday at 8 p.m. Free. Greenwich Library, 101 West Putnam Avenue. (203) 622-7900.

Guilford ''Exhibition of Miniatures,'' works by Tom Edwards, Gail Friedland and others. Through April 22. Guilford Art Center, 411 Church Street. (203) 453-5947.

Hartford ''Soul Food: African American Cooking and Creativity,'' art and artifacts exploring Southern cooking and culture; presented by the Amistad Center for Art and Culture. Through April 22. $3 to $10; members and children 12 and under, free. ''Faith and Fortune: Five Centuries of European Masterworks,'' exhibition of European masterworks and sculpture from the museum's collection. Through Dec. 9. $3 to $10; members and children 12 and under, free. ''Picasso to Pop: Aspects of Modern Art,'' exhibition of the museum's holdings from many 20th-century genres. Through Nov. 18. $3 to $10; members and children 12 and under, free. ''Connecticut Contemporary,'' a group of 24 local artists exhibit their work. Thursday through Aug. 12. $3 to $10; members and children 12 and under, free. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; first Thursdays of the month, 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art, 600 Main Street. (860) 838-4058.

Mashantucket ''Booming Out: Mohawk Ironworkers Build New York,'' photographs and sculpture documenting the Mohawk sky-walking construction tradition passed through six generations. Through May 27. $10 to $15; children under 6, free. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; last admission, 3 p.m. Mashantucket Pequot Museum and Research Center, 110 Pequot Trail. (800) 411-9671.

Middletown ''A Newspaperman's Eye,'' American photographs from the collection of Russell G. D'Oench. Through May 27. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Davison Art Center, 301 High Street, Wesleyan University. (860) 685-2500.

Middletown ''Brushwork by Kazuaki Tanahashi.'' Tuesday through May 6. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Mansfield Freeman Center for East Asian Studies Gallery, Wesleyan University, 343 Washington Terrace. (860) 685-2330.

New Haven ''Random Access Memory,'' works dealing with memory by Liz Pagano and Colleen Tully. Through April 29. Free. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Arts + Literature Laboratory, 319 Peck Street. (203) 671-5175.

New Haven ''Women's Studies: New Works by Mary Lesser.'' Thursday through April 29. Reception: April 15, 3 to 6 p.m. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. City Gallery, 994 State Street. (203) 782-2489.

New Haven ''Ceramic Abstraction: Exploration and Evidence,'' a juried group exhibition. Through May 4. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Creative Arts Workshop, 80 Audubon Street. (203) 562-4927.

New Haven ''New Haven's Garment Workers: An Elm City Story,'' photographs and artifacts documenting the 20th-century garment industry. Through May 4. Free. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to noon. Ethnic Heritage Center, 270 Fitch Street. (203) 392-6126.

New Haven ''Surface Explorations,'' works by Karen Green Recor. Through April 28. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. White Space Gallery, 1020 Chapel Street. (203) 495-1200.

New Haven ''UNStudio: Evolution of Space,'' exhibition of five projects by the Amsterdam-based firm. Through May 4. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Yale School of Architecture Gallery, 180 York Street. (203) 432-2889.

New Haven ''Made for Love: Selections From the Jane Katcher Collection of Americana,'' 30 works of art that focus on the ways love and friendship are expressed through gift exchange. Through Aug. 26. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 6 p.m. Yale University Art Gallery, (203) 432-0600.

New London ''Beyond Voodoo: Art From Haiti,'' works by various artists. Through April 28. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 4 p.m. ALVA Gallery, 54 State Street. (860) 437-8664.

New London ''Gas in Glass: The Light Sculptures of Mundy Hepburn.'' Through June 24. $3 and $4; children 6 and under, free. ''Expresiones/Expressions: Caribbean and Latin American Art From the Benjamin Ortiz Collection.'' Through June 24. $3 and $4; children 6 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Lyman Allyn Art Museum, 625 Williams Street. (860) 443-2545.

New Milford ''Rural Wealth,'' photographs by Ray Kwiatkowski. Through May 5. Hours: Mondays, Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. New Milford Public Library, 24 Main Street. (860) 355-1191.

Old Lyme ''Shadows and Pulls: A Short History,'' photographs by Ellen Carey. Through May 5. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Diane Birdsall Gallery, 68 Lyme Street. (860) 434-3209.

Old Lyme ''The Freedom Business: Connecticut Landscapes Through the Eyes of Venture Smith,'' poems by Marilyn Nelson paired with paintings from the museum's collection. Through June 24. $4 to $8; under 6, free. ''A Circle of Friends: The Artists of the Florence Griswold Museum.'' Through July 1. $4 to $8; under 6, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Florence Griswold Museum, 96 Lyme Street. (860) 434-5542.

Ridgefield ''The Photograph as Canvas,'' works by artists who draw or paint on photographs. Through June 10. ''Tekrar,'' sound installation by David Abir. Through Aug. 12. ''W(E)AVE,'' sound and textile collaboration between Elana Herzog and Michael Schumacher. Through Aug. 12. ''Blow Ups: Spores, Pollen and Pollutants,'' works by Kysa Johnson. Through June 10. ''Castles, Dwarfs, and Happychaps,'' work by Arturo Herrera created using the Renaissance technique of pouncing. Through Sept. 2. ''Chrysanthemum Anthems,'' sculpture by Dario Robleto based on American soldiers' experience of wars. Through June 17. $7; seniors and students, $4; members, K-12 teachers and children under 18, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Aldrich Contemporary Art Museum, 258 Main Street. (203) 438-4519.

Storrs ''Intemperate Times: Kathe Kollwitz, 1918-1934.'' Through May 6. ''Tradition and Innovation: Latin American Art From the Benton Collection.'' Through June 17. ''Old Master Drawings and Prints,'' exhibition of 15 Italian and Dutch works dating from 1539 to 1690. Through May 6. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 4:30 p.m. William Benton Museum of Art, 245 Glenbrook Road. (860) 486-4520.
West Hartford Works by Paul Bowen and Pat de Groot. Through May 5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Brick Walk Fine Art, 322 Park Road. (860) 233-1730.
Westport Oil paintings by Yetvart Kaprielian. Through April 27. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Galerie Je Reviens, 991 Post Road East. (203) 227-7716.

Westport ''States of Connecticut,'' a juried exhibition with works by various artists. Through April 29. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Westport Arts Center, 51 Riverside Avenue. (203) 222-7070.

Westport ''Art and the Good Earth: As Seen Through the Painter's Eye,'' works by 14 artists. Through May 11. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Westport Historical Society, 25 Avery Place. (203) 224-1424.

Willimantic ''Indigo: Traditional Chinese Blue Textiles.'' Through April 22. $5; students and seniors, $3.50. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Windham Textile and History Museum, 411 Main Street. (860) 456-2178.

Wilton ''Beyond the Lines,'' monoprints and paintings by Susan Newbold. Through Wednesday. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Rockwell Art Gallery in Wilton, 379 Danbury Road. (203) 762-8311.

Woodbury ''Pattern Play,'' paintings by Anne Hebebrand and sculpture by Diana Chamberlain. Through May 13. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Fenn Gallery, 345 Main Street South. (203) 263-3449.
